üëãüèæAbout Me

Growing up, I was always fascinated with technology. As the eldest of seven, I was always the go-to person for setting up new devices, downloading software, and troubleshooting issues. Sometimes, I hated being the only one with the "know-how," but this led me to pursue a career where I could be the solution.

So, in 2011, I started my journey in tech by enlisting in the U.S. Army as a Signal Support Systems Specialist (Military Occcupational Specialty: 25U). I was responsible for establishing field and vehicular communications, including all equipment that sends or receives signals. You could say that I was the "IT guy" for many units.

In 2019, I attended Bottega University's Full Stack Development program to expand upon my interests. Here, I developed the ability to learn JavaScript and bring ideas to fruition. I could now build technology to solve problems and be the "end solution" for others.

I've held roles as a Systems Administrator, IT Support Specialist, and Software Engineer; solidifying my passion for technology. Now, I apply my talents to continually learn and grow as a developer and IT professional. Utilizing the principles I learned from Security+ and a variety of experiences, I strive to build secure, scalable, and reliable applications.
